content:

subject: Brazil right-wing presidential candidate Bolsonaro wins election, according to official results
Brazil right-wing presidential candidate Bolsonaro at 56% vs. Haddad at 44%, according to exit poll
ASIAN DAILY ECONOMIC RELEASES CALENDAR NOW AVAILABLE IN THE RESEARCH SECTION: Highlights include Japanese Retail Sales
DAILY ASIA-PAC OPENING NEWS
content:
ASIA-PAC

US President Trump said on Friday that China wants to make a deal badly but are not ready yet. (Newswires)

China is said to view USD/CNY of 7.00 as an 'important' level and would likely intervene at that stage to prevent a rapid decline, according to sources. (Newswires)

Chinese Industrial Profits (Sep) Y/Y 4.1% (Prev. 9.2%). (Newswires)

BoJ is said to be mulling making a slight change to the timing of its government bond purchases in which it is mulling making bond purchases 2 days after new debt is auctioned from the current of 1 day. (Newswires)


UK/EU

UK Chancellor Hammond said UK will require new tax and spending plans, as well as an extension of austerity policies in the event of a no deal Brexit, while he added BoE may also need to act by adjusting interest rates. (Sky News)

S&P affirmed Italy at BBB; outlook cut to negative from stable, and affirmed Germany at AAA; outlook stable. (Newswires)

Fitch affirmed United Kingdom at AA; Outlook Negative, affirmed the Netherlands at AAA; Outlook Stable and affirmed Latvia at A-; Outlook Stable. (Newswires)
 

FX

Brazil conducted the 2nd round of its Presidential Election in which far-right leader Bolsonaro is seen likely be the winner as polls had him ahead heading into the election and considering he had the most votes at the 1st round of voting. (Newswires)

COMMODITIES

Baker Hughes Rig Count (26/Oct): Oil rigs up 2 at 875, gas rigs down 1 at 193, total rigs up 1 at 1068. (Newswires)

Russian Energy Minister Novak stated sees no grounds for lowering oil output. (Newswires)

Iraq will stop trucking Kirkuk crude oil to Iran in November in compliance with US sanctions, according to sources. (Newswires)
 

US

US Ways and Means Chair Brady said President Trump’s tax cuts are to wait until 2019. (Roll Call)

Data Recap
US GDP Advance Q3 3.5% vs. Exp. 3.3% (Prev. 4.2%). (Newswires)
 

MARKET RECAP

Phillips 66 (PSX) was a top mover after beating estimates for both EPS and revenue, so did Intel (INTC) which also raised its full year guidance. Tesla (TSLA) continued on from yesterday’s gains after its strong earnings, but news broke that the automakers’ Model 3 weekly production slightly down, overall quarterly production close to 25,000 cars, according to Electrek; additionally, the criminal investigation examining if Model 3 production was misstated intensified in recent weeks, sources reported. Expedia (EXPE) traded higher after beating EPS estimates. Cabot Oil & Gas (COG) another top mover following a strong beat on revenue estimates. Amazon (AMZN) weighed down the consumer discretionary sector after missing revenue estimates and providing Q4 revenue guidance below expectations. Western Digital (WDC) cliff-dived following mentioning a decline in flash-memory pricing. Digital Realty Trust (DLR) also a bottom mover after reporting less than expected FFO. Advanced Micron Devices (AMD) continued its losses from yesterday. SPX -1.74% at 2658, NDX -2.34% at 6852, DJI -1.20% at 24686.

subject: ASIA-PAC SERVICE IS NOW LIVE FOR TODAY'S SESSION
